blocks.content: The next step in your journey is to install Grafana Alloy. Alloy offers native pipelines for OTel, Prometheus, Pyroscope, Loki, and many other metrics, logs, traces, and profile tools.
In the **Install Alloy** section, click **Run Grafana Alloy**.
You must either use an existing token or create a new one. The token safeguards against unauthorized access, ensuring that only you can install Alloy on your Mac.
Click **Create new token** (or **Use an existing token** if you have one).
Verify that the **Enable Remote Configuration** toggle is set to on.

On your Mac, open Terminal and run the following command to install Alloy:

```
brew install grafana/grafana/alloy
```

It may take a few minutes to install.
Return to Grafana Cloud and scroll down to the **Set up the Alloy Configuration** section.
Click **Copy to Clipboard** to copy the configuration command.
Paste the contents into your Mac Terminal and press **Enter**. Enter your macOS password when requested. Once complete, you'll see `Alloy is ready to run`.

Run the following command to restart Alloy:

```
brew services restart grafana/grafana/alloy
```
Return to Grafana Cloud and click **Test Alloy connection**. If Grafana Alloy is installed correctly, you'll see `Awesome! Grafana Alloy is good to go`.
Click **Proceed to install integration** to continue.
